territory_control.SAF_controlled: Controlled by Sudanese Armed Forces and allies

territorial_changes.RSF_occupations: Rapid Support Forces occupy most of Darfur, Khartoum State, Gezira State, and parts of White Nile, Sennar, Al Qadarif, North and West Kordofan.
territorial_changes.SPLM-N_occupations: SPLM-N (al-Hilu) occupies parts of South Kordofan and Blue Nile State.

overview.description: A war between the Sudanese Armed Forces (SAF) under Abdel Fattah al-Burhan and the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces (RSF) under Hemedti began on 15 April 2023. Fighting has been concentrated around the capital city of Khartoum and the Darfur region. As of October 2023, between 9,000 and 10,000 people had been killed and 6,000 to 12,000 others injured. The war has caused significant internal displacement and refugee crisis.

key_events.event: Outbreak of war between SAF and RSF.
Momentum swings towards the RSF as they make significant gains.

international_involvement.negotiations: Attempts by international powers to negotiate a ceasefire resulted in the Treaty of Jeddah, which did not stop the fighting.
international_involvement.support: Many countries have provided military or political support for either al-Burhan or Hemedti.

summary: The War in Sudan is an ongoing conflict between the Sudanese Armed Forces and Rapid Support Forces, with various factions and foreign support involved. The war has resulted in thousands of deaths, widespread displacement, and a significant humanitarian crisis.
